content.webTitle: Inquiry begins into work of stem-cell pioneer

fields.headline: Inquiry begins into work of stem-cell pioneer
fields.bodyText: Seoul National University launched an investigation yesterday into the work of the leading stem cell researcher Hwang Woo-suk, amid allegations that he faked nine of his 11 stem cell colonies. A panel was questioning him and fellow researchers as officials sealed off offices and secured materials in their laboratories. On Friday Prof Hwang acknowledged "fatal errors" in a May article in the US journal Science, which purported to show how his team created custom-made embryonic stem cells for 11 patients. Prof Hwang admitted there were only eight stem cell lines when he submitted the paper, but that his team later created three more.
